dublin_core.dcvalue: As prevalence of autism spectrum disorder continues to increase so too does the need for timely accessible diagnostic consultation The present work extends from a previous study which provided preliminary evidence for the feasibility of expert clinicians to utilize telemedicine to triage autism spectrum disorder risk in young children However it did not examine whether a telediagnostic model had a demonstrable impact on tertiary care center referrals and usage We therefore examined whether the introduction of telemedicine based diagnostic consultation for families served by a rural medical facility affected referrals overall as well as to a metropolitan tertiary care diagnostic center Results suggest that telemedicine diagnostic consultation in partnership with a referring early intervention system may positively impact referrals for diagnostic evaluation as well as the ability of families to schedule and attend appointments
Autism : the international journal of research and practice
Measuring the service system impact of a novel telediagnostic service program for young children with autism spectrum disorder.
